newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: PRESS DIGEST - Ivory Coast - April 24.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Ivory Coast - April 24.

text.p: These are significant items in the Ivorian press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these items and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- President Henri Konan Bedie and six ministers to visit China and Singapore; scheduled to leave today Thursday via Paris, where he will have talks with French president Jacques Chirac.

- Spiralling medicine prices since devaluation of the CFA franc in 1994 have left poorer Ivorians more dependent on street vendors and traditional African cures; polio innoculation rates reached 99 percent of the population after an early 1997 immunisation campaign, Fraternite Matin investigation shows.

- Ivorian author Samba Diarra's critical history of Ivory Coast since independence from France in 1960 ("Les Faux Complots d'Houphouet Boigny") stirs debate, and comment on current student strikes and President Henri Konan Bedie's pledges of more open government.

- Beginning of Ivory Coast's main rainy season threatens traffic snarls as road repairs remain outstanding - Bakers and cake makers union (SNBCI) locked in talks with main flour supplier, Grands Moulins d'Abidjan (GMA), over new quality protocol after complaints about humidity.
